f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal seeks to solve the problem of recording post high school and university experience and education for life long learners by integrating formal records with Massive Open Online Courses credentials using Atala Prism  which aligns with the challenge goal of a foundational Education Census registy.
The proposal could be improved by articulating the value to Cardano ecosystem, articulating how the solution scales to address future challenges, providing key metrics and goals that closely align with the challenge. The proposal is extremely sparse on details.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal's feasibility could be improved by evidence of experience (linkedin profile), team composition, budget broken down and reasonable (not enough details to determine), realistic timetable and plan, resources required, detailed technical explanation of the solution and a challenges and risks section.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal includes a clear understandable description of the targeted problem.
To improve the proposal include a roadmap, milestones, time horizon, metrics/KPIs to measure proposal success and a detailed description of the solution that addresses the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea for an ID for MOOC users may not be directly contributing to nation-building but an open infrastructure/systems which can be used for running programs like universal literacy may contribute to developing nations.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal aims to create an ID system for all MOOCs users. This is in line with the goal of the Atala Prism project. However, the proposal needs more details on the team behind the proposal and how it will be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The details regarding the proposer, team, and reasonable road map is not included in the proposal. The rationale for arriving at $30000 is also not clear.
